geocoding-error-details.description: There was a problem georeferencing your data
geocoding-error-details.title: Geocoding Error
geocoding-error-details.try-again: Please try again and if the problem persists, contact us with the following code:

geocoding-success-detail.amount-charged: $%{price} will be charged to your account
geocoding-success-detail.credits-consumed: You have consumed all your credits during this billing cycle, price is $%{price} / 1,000 extra credits.
geocoding-success-detail.description: We've successfully geocoded <%- realRowsFormatted %> <%- geometryType %> of <%- processableRowsFormatted %>. |||| We've successfully geocoded <%- realRowsFormatted %> <%- geometryType %>s of <%- processableRowsFormatted %>.
geocoding-success-detail.explanation: Rows that are not geocoded could have errors on their column values, or just doesn’t exist in our data. Try geocoding again and check the 'override all values' to try again.
geocoding-success-detail.no-extra-charge: No extra charges have been done
geocoding-success-detail.remainingQuotaFormatted: You still have %{remainingQuotaFormatted} credits left for this month.
geocoding-success-detail.title: Data geocoded
geocoding-success-detail.try-again: Unsuccessful rows don't count against your quota, so we encourage you to take a look and try again.

geocoding-no-result-details.description: These rows contained empty values or perhaps we just didn't know what the values meant. We encourage you to take a look and try again.
geocoding-no-result-details.title: No rows were georeferenced

warnings-details.find-connected-datasets: You can find all the connected datasets under the datasets section.
warnings-details.no-more-datasets: No more than %{maxTablesPerImport} datasets can be imported from a single file.
warnings-details.unable-to-import-datasets: Unable to import all datasets in file

partial-import-details.find-connected-datasets: You can find all the connected datasets under the datasets section.
partial-import-details.too-many-datasets: NOTE: The file you uploaded contained too many datasets. No more than %{maxTablesPerImport} datasets can be imported from a single file.
partial-import-details.unable-to-import-as-layers: Unable to add all imported datasets as Layers
partial-import-details.upgrade-your-account: Upgrade your account to add more than %{userMaxLayers} layers to your maps.

error-details.check-url: Check that the URL you provided is OK
error-details.dont-panic: Don’t panic, here's some info that might help

error-details.send-us-the-error-code: Persisting error? Please send us the following code

8001.description: Remove some of your datasets to gain available space or upgrade your account
8001.info: Keep your data and get more quota by upgrading your plan
8001.title: You have run out of quota

8005.description: Remove any layer or upgrade your account
8005.info: Keep your maps and get more layers quota by upgrading your plan
8005.title: You have reached your layers limit

add-analysis.modal-desc: Select the analysis you want to add

buffer.title: Buffer
buffer.desc: Calculate the area of influence of a layer determined by distance.

trade-area.title: Trade Areas
trade-area.desc: Calculate the area of a layer determined by walking, driving, or biking time, or just by distance

point-in-polygon.title: Point in polygon
point-in-polygon.desc: Analyse points in polygon (or vice versa)

kmeans.title: K-means
kmeans.desc: Grups closer points into a single one or into a group with different colors.

instagram.fallback-desc: Enable the %{brand} connector to map your photos or videos from your account in CartoDB.

box.fallback-desc: Enable the %{brand} connector in your account to map your %{brand} files in CartoDB or mantain your CartoDB maps in sync with your Box data.

mailchimp.fallback-desc: Enable the %{brand} connector in your account to map your user lists from %{brand} in CartoDB or mantain your CartoDB maps in sync with your %{brand} data.

salesforce.fallback-desc: Enable the %{brand} connector in your account to map your user lists from %{brand} in CartoDB or mantain your CartoDB maps in sync with your %{brand} data.
